<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class represents the number of cycles per resource (fractions of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cycles).  That quantity is managed here as a ratio, and accessed via the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// double cast-operator below.  The two quantities, number of cycles and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// number of resources, are kept separate.  This is used by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourcePressureView to calculate the average resource cycles</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// per instruction/iteration.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a9ce9e2b99d0fe80c3e6a18768e69576b">ReleaseAtCycles</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Numerator, Denominator;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a9ce9e2b99d0fe80c3e6a18768e69576b"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a9ce9e2b99d0fe80c3e6a18768e69576b">ReleaseAtCycles</a>() : Numerator(0), Denominator(1) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#af2b6dac0904cc39152fe84ef92112ce5"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#af2b6dac0904cc39152fe84ef92112ce5">ReleaseAtCycles</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Cycles, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ResourceUnits = 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal">      : Numerator(Cycles), Denominator(ResourceUnits) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a26ff889f8e47ac769849415c0d3e3140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">operator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> double()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Denominator &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Invalid denominator (must be non-zero).&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a0a6e691b4335d7280d71569cfb6c87be"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/releaseatcycles/#a0a6e691b4335d7280d71569cfb6c87be">getNumerator</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Numerator; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Add the components of RHS to this instance.  Instead of calculating</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the final value here, we keep track of the numerator and denominator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// separately, to reduce floating point error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Populates vector Masks with processor resource masks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The number of bits set in a mask depends on the processor resource type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Each processor resource mask has at least one bit set. For groups, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">/// number of bits set in the mask is equal to the cardinality of the group plus</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">/// one. Excluding the most significant bit, the remaining bits in the mask</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// identify processor resources that are part of the group.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///  ResourceA  -- Mask: 0b001</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///  ResourceB  -- Mask: 0b010</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">///  ResourceAB -- Mask: 0b100 U (ResourceA::Mask | ResourceB::Mask) == 0b111</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourceAB is a processor resource group containing ResourceA and ResourceB.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Each resource mask uniquely identifies a resource; both ResourceA and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourceB only have one bit set.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourceAB is a group; excluding the most significant bit in the mask, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// remaining bits identify the composition of the group.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Resource masks are used by the ResourceManager to solve set membership</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// problems with simple bit manipulation operations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#ae1d3c5a1f43dcec43774a3767b41e447">computeProcResourceMasks</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mcschedmodel">MCSchedModel</a> &amp;SM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">                              <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;</a> Masks);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns the index of the highest bit set. For resource masks, the position of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the highest bit set can be used to construct a resource mask identifier.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#ae652ac0aafced9e7ef6249d3b4e50171"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#ae652ac0aafced9e7ef6249d3b4e50171">getResourceStateIndex</a>(uint64&#95;t Mask) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(Mask &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Processor Resource Mask cannot be zero!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4f42ed6fd2569fa43f03814a17f9d94a">llvm::Log2&#95;64</a>(Mask);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compute the reciprocal block throughput from a set of processor resource</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cycles. The reciprocal block throughput is computed as the MAX between:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///  - NumMicroOps / DispatchWidth</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">///  - ProcReleaseAtCycles / #ProcResourceUnits  (for every consumed resource).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">double</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a0a98238e0b4ad204e6bf241ab4cefe47">computeBlockRThroughput</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mcschedmodel">MCSchedModel</a> &amp;SM, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DispatchWidth,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumMicroOps,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> ProcResourceUsage);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// namespace mca</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// namespace llvm</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#endif </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// LLVM&#95;MCA&#95;SUPPORT&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
